title: MetaCenter: Cardano + Metaverse
description: カルダノのコミュニティミーティングでは、コミュニケーションやネットワーキングに没頭できるインタラクティブな体験ができるスペースがありません。

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer identified the problem of lack of space for an interactive communication and networking experience for Cardano meetings. As a solution, we proposed the creation of MetaCenter, a space for superior and innovative experience for Cardano meetings. This proposal presents a great idea to increase participation in the Cardano community, in line with the community events challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer presents evidence of the experience of the architecture studio that will participate in the project but does not provide evidence of the experience of the team members, which would be important to validate their capabilities for implementing the project. The budget has been detailed and seems adequate for the proposed work. A realistic deadline for completion of the work was also established. The proposal did not consider relevant risks for the successful implementation of the project.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal clearly explained the target problem and its solution. A roadmap with milestones was presented but KPIs that are important for monitoring the success of the proposal were not provided.

f6_assessments.q0: As grand and novel as the idea is, it does not currently align with the Challenge setting nor the current development phase of Cardano itself. Throughout the Cardano ecosystem, there is heavy emphasis on educating and mass adoption of Cardano, both sometimes mesh into one objective, which is mass adoption through education. Key pointers that perhaps the proposer should note are that in this Challenge, there is a conscious effort to create meaningful participation in Project Catalyst, increase voter-proposer interaction, onboard and integrate new members into Project Catalyst etc. We have not also taken account the current focus of Cardano which is activation in the African continent. Migrating some aspects of Cardano's core interaction on a metaverse would alienate many, both from the point of view of the technical aspects such as computing power, hi-speed internet connection etc. to the social aspects such as the need to learn another layer of interaction, which is the UI of Somnium space. Things are already hard to interact with and communicate as it is. One last point the proposer should take note, shortly put, the main client here is Project Catalyst. So perhaps in future iteration, this proposal should be about how to help Project Catalyst achieve their goals in this Challenge setting. Of all the metrics in the IMPACT section, unfortunately this proposal has missed them. For future reference, reckon ideas could be bounced of within the After Town Hall to perhaps find a niche where this Metaverse idea can exist. Perhaps partnering with NFT-maker.io?
f6_assessments.q1: Given the team assembled, key collaborators onboarded and the work they have done in their past, which can be viewed through their website, the proposer will most likely achieve their goal. Budget wise, it needs to be fleshed out more. Even though the chunk of the budget goes to purchasing a lot in Somnium Space, designing an architecture building, whether virtual or physical takes time and process. That process is not reflected in their budget or detailed in the timeline. There is also actually a disconnect between the budget and timeline provided. In the timeline, there is a mention of creating MetaCenter program and it's social media communication channels but is not allocated budget for. Will these work be unpaid for? These disconnects can be hashed out by reaching out to Catalyst School for further reference on how to formulate a concise and impactful proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: There is a general roadmap of the development process with milestones, but being general there are sections that can not be audited responsibly, such as the design aspect of this MetaCenter. Because of this, questions such as, 'Is this MetaCenter design new?', 'Where is the design and brainstorming process of it?', 'What is the concept behind the appearance of MetaCenter?' and etc. might arise. These design process if existing can be translated into measurable KPI's, which unfortunately this proposal does not provide.

f6_assessments.q2:
I was not able to find the proposer's listed set of metrics and KPIs for users to follow. However, to extrapolate for voters, i see these as the helpful indicators of success:
1) Demo completion of MetaVerse on the Somnium site
2) Launch of finalized MetaVerse
3) Count of users and adoption and usage statistics.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal offers an interesting and thought-through project which aims to better connect the Cardano community. While giving details and seeming at an overall advanced stage, there are some elements which are not fully clear to an outsider: Will the center be in person (i.e., offline) or will it be a digital (i.e., online) space? If digital, how exactly will it be similar to an in-person meeting space? Does it in any way relate to the company metaverse (Facebook)? Why is a VIP lounge needed? How does having social media benefit the project?
Clarifying these questions for an outsider-audience which may not be familiar with these virtual places would benefit the otherwise very strong proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal is backed by a team that brings experience and proficiency in complementing areas, and the project seems to be in an advanced stage already, thereby making successful implementation likely.
f6_assessments.q2: The progress is clearly explained through the timeline provided. Success KPIs could, however, be added, such as doing an evaluation with community members.
